title: identifying these typefaces
content:
Hi Guys,

Do you guys know which typefaces that these guys using? esp. The first three attachment(pete teo, logo, the cardigans)because I really love with those typefaces. Do you guys know similar typefaces like that? also, good for bookd esign/cover magazine.

The last three attachments is just because I am curious and seems these days, those kind of typefaces are in the trendiness.

Thanks :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [eteteo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/eteteo.jpg) | 22.83 KB |
| [logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_25.jpg) | 10.31 KB |
| [start\_random\_4.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/start_random_4.jpg) | 17.46 KB |
| [type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/type_31.jpg) | 94.94 KB |
| [nelson.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/nelson.jpg) | 71.23 KB |
| [newadventures.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/files/newadventures.jpg) | 39.8 KB |

 [‹ Typsetting font id](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/node/39955 "Go to previous forum topic") [Art deco-ish font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/typophile.com/node/39895 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Avalon

comments.content:
This should be moved to the Type ID Board.

“logo.jpg” is Avant Garde Gothic Bold  
“start\_random\_4.jpg” is Futura Extrabold

• eteteo looks like it might be a free font.

• new adventures looks like a squooshed® Eagle Bold

• t-y-p-e looks like Alba from Fontalicious

[http://www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=FOLI-ALBA](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=FOLI-ALBA "http://www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=FOLI-ALBA")

• Nelson might be Myriad Pro Condensed Bold?

Thanks a millions guys!

ugh where I can a squooshed® Eagle Bold?

by the way,free font? means the designer created by himself? now ownder, I have been looking around for quite while in the last few days but couldn’t find it anywhere :(  
is there anything similar?

Eagle Bold

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eagle+bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eagle+bold "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eagle+bold")

the free font, um, if you’ve already checked [www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.dafont.com/ "www.dafont.com"), then I’m not sure where else.

PETE TEO: the rounds in the P don’t match the rounds in the O, which makes me think it’s a free font.
In the last attachment, “Typography” is [Volupia](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/volupia/) by Dino dos Santos.

Thanks again guys :)

uhmm yeah I was scanning dafont, yesterday and can’t find it. Damn, I really like that font. I do think it was customized by the designer. I was really trying to dig about this font so, I even found his flickr account lol  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/264286213/in/set-72157594318702341/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/264286213/in/set-72157594318702341/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/264286213/in/set-72157594318702341/")  
Just want to share:  
Love what he did with the typefaces and I bet that also, another custom typefaces  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/1848221702/in/set-72157594199483839...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/1848221702/in/set-72157594199483839/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/subdisc/1848221702/in/set-72157594199483839/")

I know it’s quite out of content with the topic  
but its that hard to make a custom typeface like what he did?  
Except, logo design, I rarely customized typefaces and never created from A - Z letters

If you want to learn more about type design maybe read my series _An Introduction to Type Design_ on Unzipped. I don’t really focus on type design software and technicalities, but it should give you a pretty good idea what it entails. The bit about spacing and kerning is coming up.

**Episode 1** [An Introduction to Type Design | The Type Designer as Artist](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=161)  
**Episode 2** [An Introduction to Type Design | The Type Designer as Craftsman](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184503/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=230)

Thanks man! thats really useful! and its more easy to read than Rober Bringhurst books!

Please update me if you comes up with the new episode or need some help :) or If the athor release a book! I would like to buy one cuz I always sketching up tons typefaces during lunch or when I am in the bus but! I never found a way how to do it or just simply afraid that my font is going to be look the same with some other fonts out there.
